page.title: 01A General Review.
page.content:
This 4 x 3 km block encloses the villages of{Waldringfield}to the{west and{Shottisham}in the{east},with the{ {River Deben}running from NW to south. The river is tidal and,as large areas of mud flats are exposed at low tide, only a narrow channel is navigable.To the south of the block is an area of{ {marsh}known as the{Hemley Saltings}.
Waldringfield village comes down to the river and sailing provides both local leisure and light industry.
Shottisham is an inland village with a smallcreek running through and a few local businesses.{
The{land}in the rest of the block is used almost exclusively for{ {agriculture}with small pockets of { {mixed woodland}.
